refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: letsencrypt invokes any of several utilities involved in controlling the Opportunistic Encryption system, running the specified command with the specified arguments as if it had been invoked directly.
ipsec letsencrypt -h lists the available commands.

refsect1.title: COMMANDS
refsect1.para: To get a list of supported commands, use ipsec letsencrypt -h. A few of the commonly used commands are described below
ipsec letsencrypt -client OR ipsec letsencrypt -server For initial setup.
ipsec letsencrypt test OR ipsec letsencrypt -t For testing the configuration/connections.
ipsec letsencrypt generatecertificate hostname OR ipsec letsencrypt -gc hostname For generating the certificate.
certbot renew --deploy-hook 'ipsec letsencrypt -ug hostname' For updating the generated certificate (keeping the private key same).

refsect1.title: RETURN CODE
refsect1.para: The ipsec command passes the return code of the sub-command back to the caller.
